result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Peters Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $350 bail applied. Total costs to be paid while on supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
No contact with any Walmart or any business in Ozaukee County without approval from agent.
Defendant to submit DNA sample within 30 days.
Pay supervision fees.
Restitution - paid in full
